sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The enclave's health ministry says the offensive has resulted in the death of more than 18,400 Palestinians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There are reports in U.S. media that Israel has recently begun pumping seawater into Hamas' vast labyrinth of tunnels underneath Gaza, in a process that is likely to take weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There's also concerns some of the hostages may be held underground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, heavy rainfall flooded Gaza's streets and camps sheltering thousands of displaced people, adding to what has been described as hell-on-earth conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Despite the eruption of the Israel-Hamas war, the number of journalists killed in the course of their work has fallen to its lowest level since 2002. The annual report of reporters sans frontier or reporters without borders says 45 media professionals have lost their lives in 2023, 17 of them covering Israel's war against Hamas. The figure includes those caught in the shelling of a group of journalists in southern Lebanon, in which one person died. The RSF report shows the casualty rate has stabilized in recent years, in the 50s and 60s. The decline is largely explained by the increased safety of journalists working in Syria and Iraq since 2013. There's also been a large drop in deaths in Latin America, falling from 26 last year to six in 2023.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the region remains dangerous, with armed attacks and kidnappings a constant threat for media members in some countries, particularly Mexico.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Having just completed a series of meetings looking for support from international leaders, there's a lot riding on today's European Union summit for Ukraine's president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelensky is looking to maintain the EU's political and financial support for his wartime administration, as well as gaining a favourable response regarding the opening of accession negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: However, one of the main obstacles is Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: EU Council President Charles Michel met with the Hungarian leader on the eve of the summit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Orban has threatened to veto a massive aid package of 50 billion euros and a promise of formal membership talks with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The EU has unblocked just over 10 billion euros of funding for Hungary, ostensibly a reward for Orban's government reforms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But it's unclear if the Hungarian leader will change his mind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: On social media until now, he said he does not support Ukraine, saying its accession to the EU would be a disaster for the bloc's farmers, its budget and security. For Ukraine, the summit is crucial at a time when Kyiv's war back home has stalled and there's doubt over much-needed U.S. military aid. Zelensky says his country has fulfilled everything required to start accession negotiations and that a negative outcome would effectively represent what he described as a Putin veto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Dow Jones closed at a new record high on Wednesday evening following news that the U.S. central bank said it could start cutting interest rates next year if inflation continues to fall. Although the Federal Reserve did keep rates unchanged again at 5.25 to 5.5 percent, which is admittedly a 22-year high, markets surged on signs that borrowing costs could be reduced in 2024. Wall Street likes this because it's good for the economy to have lower rates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: That means it's cheaper for families and households and businesses and everybody to borrow money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If you have a mortgage on your house or you're going to buy a car, those rates have been going up a lot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And that's because of the Fed. And the Fed raises rates to slow down the economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And now that they think that they may be done slowing down the economy enough the federal reserve has indicated it's looking more likely that it will cut rates several times in 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Uber drivers or Deliveroo delivery workers, are they freelance or are they employees of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: these companies? An agreement between the EU institutions reached Wednesday in Brussels should help answer this question as it seeks to regulate and improve the working conditions of platform workers. The deal fixes what the criteria are for them to be considered employees of the companies they work for. There can't be fake self-employed workers around, among riders, among working classes, which are among the most exploited, among the least paid, among the most precarious.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Either you are a true self-employed worker, or you are a self-employed worker and you deserve social protection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The agreement establishes five key indicators, which include whether the company fixes up limits to the employees' remuneration, supervises their performance through an app, controls the distribution of their tasks, chooses their working hours and makes them wear corporate clothing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: If two of these criteria are fulfilled, then workers should be made employees and benefit from social rights, including paid holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: For some MEPs, one of the difficulties has been dealing with the platform companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The lobbyists of the platforms have managed to find allies within the parliament but especially within the Council of the European Union which represents the member states and so until the last moment they have done everything to untie, to sabotage the directive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have gone to our fingertips, you know, to have a directive that is not favourable for workers but that is favourable for the platforms, that is a pro-Uber directive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Representatives from the platforms have not replied to Euronews' request for comment, and according to data from the European Parliament, around 5.5 workers are now worryingly misclassified as freelance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The new law will also make algorithms more transparent and clarify for workers how they are used to allocate work, as well as how their personal data is treated. also make algorithms more transparent and clarify for workers how they are used to allocate work, as well as how their personal data is treated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Armenia and Azerbaijan have exchanged prisoners of war at the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's a first step towards normalizing relations since Azerbaijan retook control of Nagorno-Karabakh in a September military operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It ended almost three decades of Armenian control of the separatist region and saw most of its ethnic Armenian residents flee. The exchange comes a week after the longtime enemies issued a joint statement pledging to achieve what they described as a long-awaited peace in the region.
